title: Boole's expansion theorem
summary: Boole's expansion theorem, often referred to as the Shannon expansion or decomposition, is the identity: F = x ⋅ F x + x ′ ⋅ F x ′ {\displaystyle F=x\cdot F_{x}+x'\cdot F_{x'}} , where F {\displaystyle F} is any Boolean function, x {\displaystyle x} is a variable, x ′ {\displaystyle x'} is the complement of x {\displaystyle x} , and F x {\displaystyle F_{x}} and F x ′ {\displaystyle F_{x'}} are F {\displaystyle F} with the argument x {\displaystyle x} set equal to 1 {\displaystyle 1} and to 0 {\displaystyle 0} respectively.
